page.title: 08PLUMTREE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: The Telephone Exchange serves 5 villages,Plumtree,Tollerton,Keyworth Stanton on the Wolds and Normanton.The Exchange was built in 1958 and is next to Plumtree School.There are 4600 telephones connected there.Because each telephone needs 2 wires.There are 9200 wires going into the building. Each call is timed on a meter and photographed.The numbers on the meter are used to work out the bill. In about 2 years the Exchange will be totally modernized.All the testers,meters and 4 point setters will be replaced by micro chips. The Exchange is run by 1 person, Mr White.To make it safer for him the Exchange runs on 50 volts.If there is a power cut a generater is automatcally swiched on.If that fails there are batteries which could keep up the power for 24 hours.
